data.text: @DonaldClarke63 The picture caption describes Allen as "the disgraced filmmaker". If this connotes Allen's run of mediocre movies, then perhaps the charge stands. As for any sexual misconduct, re MeToo, then the case against Allen is far from proven. Subs should re-edit. Good review, though.
@DonaldClarke63 @CaomhanKeane He got mostly panned by the critics here, which was justified in my eyes.
@DonaldClarke63 Goodbye Woody Allen.. https://t.co/cwGvOGJbGT

@DonaldClarke63 @babysses I loved them, fanatically, owned both albums and danced on stage (with about 20 others) with them. I can only remember "Fuck Forever" which I am fairly sure is not a Libertines but a Babyshambles track.I must have gotten some kind of concussion that erased the facts of my fandom
@DonaldClarke63 @LukeMaxwell yeah that's the impression I'm getting.
@theJoeGriffin @LukeMaxwell I wouldn't go out of your way.
@CaomhanKeane @babysses That is the correct use of that verb. Despite owning the second album, I could now name only "Can't Stand Me Now" if a gun was put to my head.
@TimWil014 @CaomhanKeane Is he? I thought he was tolerable enough.

@LukeMaxwell @DonaldClarke63 I re-watched a few favourites last year, but I don't have the heart to do it now. If Wonder Wheel was critically adored, it might present a dilemma, but it ain't, so that's that problem solved.
@theJoeGriffin @DonaldClarke63 I almost, just about, nearly watched Crimes and Misdemeanors the other day. Got distracted and didn’t come back to it. Don’t have the heart for Wonder Wheel.
@DonaldClarke63 I wonder if I'll ever watch (or re-watch) a Woody Allen film again.
@CaomhanKeane @DonaldClarke63 Timberlake is absolutely terrible in Wonder Wheel.
@DonaldClarke63 @babysses Champion. I championed them Donald!
@CaomhanKeane @babysses I knew there was a Libertines fan out there somewhere.

@DonaldClarke63 @babysses I was in my early 20s. My critical incisors were only pushing out their baby predecessors. It was an innocent time. When I thought Meryl Streep was the world's greatest actress and The Libertines were the future of music. https://t.co/6XQbO7jWM4

@babysses @CaomhanKeane I think that felt forced. There’s an infinitely better treatment of those themes in the “Crimes” half of Crimes and Misdemeanours. I think the absurd version of England in Match Point is also a problem.
@DonaldClarke63 @CaomhanKeane In my defense, I was raised on classic Russian literature (often against my will) and Match Point is by far the best fun I’ve ever seen anyone have with Dostoyevsky.

@CaomhanKeane It maybe looks a little *too* gorgeous. I’m interested you and @babysses liked Match Point. The greatest ever divergence between US critics (who loved it) and UK/Ire critics (who hated it). Barry Norman declared it the absolute worst Allen.

@DonaldClarke63 I must rewatch Match Point. I remember loving it when it came out. The minute I saw Justin Timberlake’s face pop into view in the trailer I was out on this one...though it looks gorgeous

@DonaldClarke63 You must be joking. Match Point was an absolute delight*! 

*minus a couple of awful lines like “He saw me across the room and he honed in on me like a guided missile” https://t.co/yirnC6eLAh
@JP_Mc_C Good heavens. How is that possible? There are dozens and dozens of them.
